data.title: Exposing edit_resource method of EditorNode in the EditorPlugin
data.body: I'm trying to open a script in the editor using GDScript. The easiest way that i found, was exposing the edit_resource method of EditorNode.

data.title: Vector2 division breaks the editor
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
2.2.1

**Issue description** (what happened, and what was expected):
Typing out Vector2 division immediately crashes the editor, and opening the project afterwards causes the editor to immediately crash again until you remove the line using some other method.

**Steps to reproduce:**
I wrote this line in the _ready call of an otherwise empty script in an empty scene.

Vector2(5, 0)/Vector2(1, 0)

data.title: Crash when using export keyword incorrectly
data.body:
OS: Linux, 64-bit
Godot: 2.1 stable

Using the following code will result in a crash (but only when the Inspector tab is visible for that specific node):
```
export var My_Var = Area2D
```
The expected result would be an error message, explaining that you can't assign a node type as value.

My bet: the error must be in somewhere in the code of the Inspector, because it only occurs when the Inspector is visible. The inspector will try to add the exported variable in the Script Variables and will fail there.

data.title: Polyline
data.body:
Added a Line2D node that draws a polygon-based line.
It supports unlimited width, color gradient, texture and some geometry options for joints and caps. Also transparency without artifacts (provided that line joints aren't too sharp).

~~Points cannot be visually edited yet because I have to figure out how to do that without duplicating too much similar code from existing editors (polygon2d, shape2d...).~~
Some features can be added over time such as variable width (would be nice to provide that through a FloatCurve resource) and more texturing options.

EDIT: points can be edited now :)

The logic that builds the line can be re-used for a future Trail2D node.

data.title: Make possible set the Margin of PhysicsBody2D->Collision as 0.0
data.body:
OS: Linux, x86_64
Version: 2.2 alpha

This is a feature-request (or enhancement). Currently, the minimum value for margin grow is 0.001.

I'm making a "pixel-perfect" demo which I want to make open, and everything works fine, including sticking to slopes. The objective is to make it work like a classic platformer (which is a bit different from the Kinematic Character demo available), and is based on the Game Maker tutorial by Shaun on youtube.

However, if I want  to make a character of, for example, 8x8 pixels to walk between a little space of 8x8 space, I need to set the collision shape of the character to 7x7 (3.5, 3.5 of extents) and margin 0.5.

If I understand right, the margin growing will make the collision shape of the character act as if it was 8x8, and that's why it is currently fitting right.

It would be nice to be able to set the margin as 0.0 and just use the extents, so anyone else can make new collision shapes without having to worry about the sum of extents + margin grow.

Anyway, thanks for the great work on Godot!

data.title: Allows to start the scene with custom arguments within the editor
data.body:
fixes #7346

Path from the current scene isn't added too the argumens anymore by default and needs to be added throug the custom arguments, with $scene. Matches the behaviour of the executable without any arguments.
Custom Arguments are read from editor/main_run_args

data.title: Can't launch scene with custom arguments
data.body:
1. It is impossible to set arguments

2. Game with custom arguments crashes, because EditorRun::run adds then on the wrong place
(custom arg is "-s")
`running: godot.x11.tools.64 -path path/to/godot-project -rdebug localhost:6007 -epid 8564 -s -p 2368x240 res://root.tscn`
should be:
`running: godot.x11.tools.64 -path path/to/godot-project -rdebug localhost:6007 -epid 8564  -p 2368x240 res://root.tscn -s`

The second issue is easy to solve, but I don't know how you want to handle custom args. Currently the custom arguments gets set to "" by this function:
https://github.com/godotengine/godot/blob/2c8a1729152f5bcb1cb81d24b1e642634bff7174/tools/editor/editor_node.cpp#L1851

because `run_settings_dialog->set_custom_arguments();` is never called in the whole code.
And no idea where I would/should do it. My suggestion would be to add a property to EditorSettings for custom arguments.

I would do the pull request for this issue, just need to know from where we actually want to get the custom arguments.

data.title: HTTPRequest retrieves corrupted file with error
data.body:
Tested on Godot 2.1.1, Windows 10 64 bits

I wanted to test the HTTPRequest node to download an image, with the following script:

```gdscript
extends Button


onready var _request = get_node("HTTPRequest")


func _ready():
    connect("pressed", self, "_on_button_pressed")
    _request.connect("request_completed", self, "_on_request_completed")


func _on_button_pressed():
    print("Doing request...")
    _request.set_download_file("the_thing.png")
    _request.request("http://docs.godotengine.org/en/stable/_static/docs_logo.png")


func _on_request_completed(result, response_code, headers, body):
    print("Request completed ", result, ", ", response_code)
```

The request completed with response 200 but with code 1 RESULT_CHUNKED_BODY_SIZE_MISMATCH.
And this error appeared in the console:

```
ERROR: DVector<unsigned char>::resize: Condition ' mem.is_locked() ' is true. returned: ERR_LOCKED
At: c:\projects\godot-builds\godot\core\dvector.h:365
```

Is this a bad use of the node or is it a bug?

The image file was successfully created, but was corrupted. It shows in some image viewers but not on the web, here is how it looks:

![the_thing_](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1311555/21375062/4f951332-c72b-11e6-9e16-d6655c5d67b3.png)

Test project: 
[HttpRequest.zip](https://github.com/godotengine/godot/files/665302/HttpRequest.zip)

data.title: Fix error when fragment and lighting code share an uniform
data.body:
If the shader of canvas material declares the same uniform both at the fragment code and at the lighting one, the shader compilation fails.

That's because shader and lighting global code are put together. What this PR does is replacing the simple string concatenation with a more careful algorithm that checks for uniforms already declared and skips those lines.

data.title: Fix error when fragment and lighting code share an uniform
data.body:
If the shader of canvas material declares the same uniform both at the fragment code and at the lighting one, the shader compilation fails.

That's because shader and lighting global code are put together. What this PR does is replacing the simple string concatenation with a more careful algorithm that checks for uniforms already declared and skips those lines.

data.title: Bugfixes for Tree node
Implement panini projection as default camera projection
data.body:
Panini projection will not only offer lower distortion than rectilinear projection, but also allow for a much higher usable FoV (that has more gradual distortion) as seen in comparisons:

![rectilinear vs panini projection](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/shaunlebron/blinky/master/readme-img/old-and-new.jpg)
https://youtu.be/jQOJ3yCK8pI?t=24s

It will eliminate distortion at the edges of the screen and should have no distortion at 90 FoV.

Code with MIT license: https://github.com/shaunlebron/blinky

I think this should be default because distortion shouldn't be present with a low FoV, and a high FoV shouldn't be borderline unusable. That and it is quite annoying in games (especially those involving exploration) when you want to crank the FoV up enough to see the ceiling (or just feel like you aren't using a bad pair of binoculars) but can't do so without having jarring distortion near the edge of your screen.

data.title: Remove extraneous line in .po reader, which caused it to disregard first line
data.body: Fixes #7337

data.title: Improved "remapping" for localized resources - remap folders instead of individual resource files
data.body:
This suggestion comes from a feature that I've implemented in my previous game engine and is very convenient.

## The Problem

Godot has a "remapping" functionality for localization where you can remap paths for specific resources for each locale.

This is nice, but the problem is when there are lots of resources that need remapping and there are lots of locales that need to be supported then it becomes extremely time consuming to setup the mappings because you have to set them up one by one.

## A Solution

Instead of mapping each resource file one by one, I suggest mapping paths.
This could be by convention with configurable 'locales' path.

For example, consider this project structure:

```
res/
	images/
		titleScreen.png
		enemySprite.png
		playerSprite.png
	fonts/
		mainText.tres (a font resource)
	audio/
		...
```

When localizing, maybe we need to support de and es locales. Maybe we need to localize just the titleScreen and the mainText font.

We might then have this project structure:

```
res/
	images/
		titleScreen.png
		enemySprite.png
		playerSprite.png
	fonts/
		mainText.tres (a font resource)
	audio/
		...
	locales/
		de/
			images/
				titleScreen.png
			fonts/
				mainText.tres
		es/
			images/
				titleScreen.png
			fonts/
				mainText.tres
```

The idea is that, whatever needs to be changed in a locale, we add the changed version inside the correct subfolder inside the locales folder. Then the engine will use it to **_"override"_** the default file.

This way there is no need to manually setup mappings one by one. Instead you just copy the files into place and you're ready to go.

## Implementation

Godot already runs every resource file access through ```PathRemap``` singleton defined in ```path_remap.cpp```, specifically the ```get_remap``` method. This is actually very powerful as even script files (.gd) and scene files (.tscn) and everything else goes through this method.

What is needed is to only add additional functionality to ```get_remap``` to detect whether a corresponding resource file exists in the corresponding localization folder and return the path if it does.

EDIT: Upon further thought, this can actually be implemented by using PathRemap itself. What is needed is to just scan the locales path at startup to see what files are in there and setup remappings for them using PathRemap.add_remap which already has a p_locale parameter.

## Folder location

If this is to be implemented, one thing that might need to be discussed is where should the 'locales' folder be / should it be named 'locales' and should it be configurable?

Note: In my old engine, the engine supported mounting folders virtually, so what I did was just mount the correct locale folder on top of the resources folder so that the localized resources would override the other ones.

data.title: Error parsing .po file from poeditor.com (internationalization, localization)
data.body:
After adding .po file exported from poeditor.com to translations in project settings, this is output on console:

```
ERROR: :1 Unexpected 'msgstr', was expecting 'msgid' while parsing:
   At: core\io\translation_loader_po.cpp:107
ERROR: Failed loading resource: res://localization/A_Project_English.po
   At: core\io\resource_loader.cpp:218
```

contents of A_Project_English.po:
```
msgid ""
msgstr ""
"MIME-Version: 1.0\n"
"Content-Type: text/plain; charset=UTF-8\n"
"Content-Transfer-Encoding: 8bit\n"
"X-Generator: POEditor.com\n"
"Project-Id-Version: A Project\n"
"Language: en\n"

#: 
msgid "key_hello"
msgstr "Hello there!"

#: 
msgid "key_bye"
msgstr "Bye!!!"

```

This file is successfully loaded by Poedit po editor.

data.title: Z Drive won't show in drive selection dropdown
data.body:
Windows 10 - Godot 2.1 stable

In windows explorer I have multiple drives, one of which is Z:
Trying to import a project, the "Z" drive is not listed in the "Open a File" dialog's drive pulldown.
Mapping different paths to "Z" drive doesn't help. If I map the same path to a different drive letter I can access it under that drive letter. 
The dialog won't show a "Z" drive in the listing, no matter what's mapped to it but appears to show any other drive letter (ie. "A" to "Y")

data.title: Fix search to find "whole" words at end of line
data.body:
Fix `_get_column_pos_of_word` so that the `SEARCH_WHOLE_WORDS` flag will properly find words that are at the end of a line.

Fixes #7326 .

data.title: iOS fat binary creation does not work.
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
OS X Yosemite 10.10.5,  Godot 2.1-stable, Xcode 7.2.

**Issue description** (what happened, and what was expected):
I am not able to create fat binary for iOS.
In docs http://docs.godotengine.org/en/stable/reference/compiling_for_ios.html there is an instruction

> $ scons p=iphone tools=no bits=32 target=release
> $ scons p=iphone tools=no bits=64 target=release
> $ lipo -create bin/godot.iphone.opt.32 **arm64** bin/godot.iphone.opt.64 -output bin/godot.iphone.opt.universal

So I renamed the godot.iphone.opt.arm files I got after compilation accordingly, but lipo errors with
fatal error: 

> /Applications/Xcode.app/Contents/Developer/Toolchains/XcodeDefault.xctoolchain/usr/bin/lipo: can't open input file: arm64 (No such file or directory)

When I try to correct the typo and add -arch before arm64, to indicate the architecture of the input file:
`lipo -create bin/godot.iphone.opt.32 -arch arm64 bin/godot.iphone.opt.64 -output ./bin/godot.iphone.opt.universal`

>
I get error: 
> lipo: specifed architecture type (arm64) for file (./godot.iphone.opt.64) does not match its cputype (12) and cpusubtype (9) (should be cputype (16777228) and cpusubtype (0))

**UPDATE**: I additionally checked `lipo -info godot.iphone.opt.64` and it shows that it's armv7 architecture?! I am sure I did compile it with bits=64 option.

I also tried -arch arm64v8 and that ended with similar error.

I assume there is an error in docs, or there is a bug with compiling 64 bit version of iphone template.

I would appreciate if someone push me in the right direction how to compile fat binary for iOS.

data.title: A boot splash in JPG format doesn't work anymore.
data.body:

**Issue description** (what happened, and what was expected):

- What happened: A boot splash in JPG format doesn't work anymore.
- What was expected: A boot splash in JPG format should work.

**Steps to reproduce:**

   1. Set up a JPG boot splash.
   2. Play the project.
